column4: I'm able to install xlrd, for read excel spread sheet, but xlwt is not to be found in synaptic. can someone tell me why?
it's under python-xlwt
thanks
I'm on version 9.04, what release are you on. python-xlwt is not on my system.
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1361335
thanks for the pointer.
you can open excel stuff with openoffice calc and export to a more sane format like csv
I thought about doing it that way, but it would add another step to the process and I don't want to add more procedure to the process.
does that forum thread let you do what you want to?
no, I like to know why xlrd is in synaptic, but xlwt is not.

it was in older versions of ubuntu. you could try grabbing that debsrc and building it, or if you really want to know you could open a bug requesting packaging of it or try contacting the previous maintainer
http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=python-xlwt
looks like it's in karmic and lucid to me
do you thing I could use the one in karmic or licid?
i would actually recommend installing from the tar.gz on its homepage: http://pypi.python.org/pypi/xlwt
ok, thanks
will what you're making only be used on your system?
No
I plan on make web page from the data in the spread sheet.
will the python script you are making now only be run on your 9.04 jaunty ubuntu system?
I plan on testing it on my system, but the page will be on a Microsoft machine.
i just mean the actual python, not the stuff/pages it generates. but alright
thanks for your help. I'm going to think about it some more.
